00061   const uint16_t DEFAULT_DFSBROKER_PORT = 38030;
00062   const char *usage[] = {
00063     "usage: dfsTest",
00064     "",
00065     "  This program tests the operation of the DFS and DFS broker",
00066     "  by copying the file /usr/share/dict/words to the DFS via the",
00067     "  broker, then copying it back and making sure the returned copy",
00068     "  matches the original.  It assumes the DFS broker is listenting",
00069     "  at localhost:38546",
00070     (const char *)0
00071   };
00072 
00073   void test_copy(DfsBroker::Client *client, const String &testdir) {
00074     String outfileA = testdir + "/output.a";
00075     String outfileB = testdir + "/output.b";
00076 
00077     DfsTestThreadFunction thread_func(client, "words");
00078 
00079     thread_func.set_dfs_file(outfileA);
00080     thread_func.set_output_file("output.a");
00081     Thread thread1(thread_func);
00082 
00083     thread_func.set_dfs_file(outfileB);
00084     thread_func.set_output_file("output.b");
00085     Thread thread2(thread_func);
00086 
00087     thread1.join();
00088     thread2.join();
00089 
00090     if (system("diff words output.a"))
00091       exit(1);
00092 
00093     if (system("diff output.a output.b"))
00094       exit(1);
00095   }
00096 
00097   void test_readdir(DfsBroker::Client *client, const String &testdir) {
00098     ofstream filestr ("dfsTest.out");
00099     vector<string> listing;
00100 
00101     client->readdir(testdir, listing);
00102 
00103     sort(listing.begin(), listing.end());
00104 
00105     for (size_t i=0; i<listing.size(); i++)
00106       filestr << listing[i] << endl;
00107 
00108     filestr.close();
00109 
00110     if (system("diff dfsTest.out dfsTest.golden"))
00111       exit(1);
00112   }
00113 
00114   void test_rename(DfsBroker::Client *client, const String &testdir) {
00115     const char *magic = "the quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog";
00116     char buf[1024];
00117     String file_a = testdir +"/filename.a";
00118     String file_b = testdir +"/filename.b";
00119     int fd = client->create(file_a, true, -1, -1, -1);
00120     StaticBuffer sbuf((char *)magic, strlen(magic) + 1, false);
00121     client->append(fd, sbuf);
00122     client->close(fd);
00123     client->rename(file_a, file_b);
00124     fd = client->open(file_b);
00125     client->read(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00126     HT_ASSERT(strcmp(buf, magic) == 0);
00127     client->close(fd);
00128   }
00129 }

00132 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00133   try {
00134     struct sockaddr_in addr;
00135     ConnectionManagerPtr conn_mgr;
00136     DfsBroker::Client *client;
00137 
00138     Config::init(argc, argv);
00139 
00140     if (argc != 1)
00141       Usage::dump_and_exit(usage);
00142 
00143     System::initialize(argv[0]);
00144     ReactorFactory::initialize(2);
00145 
00146     InetAddr::initialize(&addr, "localhost", DEFAULT_DFSBROKER_PORT);
00147 
00148     conn_mgr = new ConnectionManager();
00149     client = new DfsBroker::Client(conn_mgr, addr, 15000);
00150 
00151     if (!client->wait_for_connection(15000)) {
00152       HT_ERROR("Unable to connect to DFS");
00153       return 1;
00154     }
00155     String testdir = format("/dfsTest%d", getpid());
00156     client->mkdirs(testdir);
00157 
00158     test_copy(client, testdir);
00159     test_readdir(client, testdir);
00160     test_rename(client, testdir);
00161 
00162     client->rmdir(testdir);
00163   }
00164   catch (Exception &e) {
00165     HT_ERROR_OUT << e << HT_END;
00166     return 1;
00167   }
00168   catch (...) {
00169     HT_ERROR_OUT << "unexpected exception caught" << HT_END;
00170     return 1;
00171   }
00172   return 0;
00173 }
